New Records: Edwin Díaz recorded his 15th save of the season.
Francisco Lindor hit his 28th home run of the season, tying it at 2 in the sixth inning.
Key Match Events: Jose Iglesias drove in Tyrone Taylor with a base hit in the ninth inning, leading the Mets to a 3-2 victory.
Francisco Lindor tied the game at 2 with a solo home run in the sixth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza noted the team's strong performance despite facing tough opponents.
Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo mentioned the team's missed opportunities to score more runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo reflected on the team's performance and mentioned the importance of turning the page.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Chase Field in Phoenix, Arizona.
The Mets improved to 6-4 over their last 10 games.
Others: Mets right-handed pitcher Dedniel Núñez was placed on the 15-day injured list with right forearm tightness.
Diamondbacks right-hander Ryne Nelson allowed two runs, both on home runs, over 6 1/3 innings.
